in_ports.name: map_buffer_id
in_ports.hint: ID of some existing map buffer.

in_ports.name: rectangle
in_ports.hint: If specified, it must be 4 numbers describing a rectangle which should be read: min_x, max_x, min_y, max_y.

out_ports.name: output
out_ports.hint: Matrix, loaded from the map buffer.

out_ports.name: expanded
out_ports.hint:
Rectangle of result matrix: source rectangle, requested to read, expanded
by the given "X/Y-expansion", but then reduced to fit into the map buffer.

out_ports.caption: containing rectangle
out_ports.name: containing_rectangle
out_ports.hint: 4 numbers describing minimal rectangle, containing all existing frames in the map buffer.

controls.caption: Y-size (height)
controls.name: sizeY
controls.description: Note: if there is an input "rectangle", 4 parameters above are ignored.

controls.caption: X-expansion
controls.name: expansionX
controls.description: Value of expansion by x-coordinate for output matrix and "expanded" rectangle.

controls.caption: Y-expansion
controls.name: expansionY
controls.description:
Value of expansion by x-coordinate for output matrix and "expanded" rectangle.
Note: the rectangle of the  matrix to read is expanded by all direction, but in such a way to be fully covered by already existing frames. So, if in some direction there is no frames yet, the rectangle will not be expanded there.
If skipped, it will be equal to X-expansion.

controls.caption: Reindex stitched objects
controls.name: reindexStitched
controls.description: If set and if the map buffer stitches object labels, the result matrix is automatically re-indexes to provide the same index for every two (or more) stitched objects.
